item.title: Ticket #179 (wp-atom.php produces invalid Atom 0.3) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: I have uploaded my fixed wp-atom.php

item.title: Ticket #179 (wp-atom.php produces invalid Atom 0.3) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: If the title or the summary of the text in the feed contains a HTML-Entity like € the Feed Validator doesn't accept the &-character in front of the entity. The problem is that the Atom-Template doesn't mark the content of the <title> and <summary> as CDATA. <title type="text/html" mode="escaped"><![CDATA[......]]></title> is valid!

item.title: Ticket #178 (WP doesn't close tags when breaking a page with < !-- more -- >) created
item.dc:creator: rq
item.description:
If I have a situation like following:

< p > text < /p > < ul >

< li > item1 < /li > < li > item2 < /li > < !-- more -- > < li > item3 < /li > .....

< /ul >

wordpress then doesn't close the < ul > tag when displaying a stripped message. XHTML becomes invalid then.

I haven't tested, but I suspect that same things happen when you break a post into pages.

item.title: Ticket #177 (Smilies should have their own class.) created
item.dc:creator: rq
item.description:
Smilie images should have their own class, imho. That would make creating stylesheets easier (i.e., you can specify smilies not to have any borders, and other images to have them).

Yes, it's a feature request, but it's really trivial.

Attaching a patch against wp-includes/vars.php

item.title: Ticket #32 (Calendar makes no use of option "start_of_week") updated
item.dc:creator: rq
item.description:
dear developers, is it so darn hard to apply a little diff??????

Love, RQ

item.title: Ticket #176 (categories.php showing wrong default category) created
item.dc:creator: Tomcat
item.description:
The categories section in my admin area says:

Deleting a category does not delete posts from that category, it will just set them back to the default category University.

My default category is another one though. The file wp-admin/categories.php uses get_catname(1) to get the category, although 1 might not necessarily be my default category.

I'm not sure if this is only a visual bug or if this is also wrong when I delete a category. Should be easy to fix though.
